line_1: Replys the Lad, you're too soon weary.
line_2: In Truth, Sir Goblin or Sir Fairy,
Still on the Stage desires to tarry:
Through the desert wild and dreary,

line_1: Through the long night impatient, sad, and weary,
line_2: Lo! cheerful day illumes my prospects dreary,

line_1: And now the Satyr growing weary,
line_2: But there I leave him to be merry,

line_1: I wat they did na weary;
line_2: Their sports were cheap an' cheary:

line_1: And pray'd till I've been weary:
And pray'd till I've been weary;
